docs.snippet: The invitations are sent and preparations are underway at the U.N.'s Palais des Nations in Geneva, where the first peace talks in two years on the conflict in Syria are to begin Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The invitations are sent and preparations are underway at the U.N.'s Palais des Nations in Geneva, where the first peace talks in two years on the conflict in Syria are to begin Friday.

headline.main: Chaotic Run-Up to Syria Peace Talks Reflects Enormous Gap
headline.print_headline: Chaotic Run-Up to Syria Peace Talks Reflects Enormous Gap

docs.snippet: Hackers were able to attack four sections of Ukraine's power grid with malware late last year because of basic security lapses and they could take down other industrial facilities at any time, a consultant to government investigators said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hackers were able to attack four sections of Ukraine's power grid with malware late last year because of basic security lapses and they could take down other industrial facilities at any time, a consultant to government investigators said.

headline.main: Exclusive: Hackers May Have Wider Access to Ukrainian Industrial Facilities

docs.snippet: Syrian Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem will head a government delegation at peace talks with the country's opposition later this week, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Gennady Gatilov said on Wednesday....

docs.snippet: Plans to hold the first negotiations to end the civil war in Syria for two years were in doubt on Wednesday after the opposition said it would not show up unless the United Nations responded to demands for a halt to attacks on civilian areas....
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans to hold the first negotiations to end the civil war in Syria for two years were in doubt on Wednesday after the opposition said it would not show up unless the United Nations responded to demands for a halt to attacks on civilian areas.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Demands Answers Before Joining Talks

docs.snippet: Senior Pentagon officials on Wednesday sought to defend the use of Russian-made rocket engines to send U.S. military satellites into space, telling exasperated lawmakers they are moving quickly to end the practice and rely on American-made rockets...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senior Pentagon officials on Wednesday sought to defend the use of Russian-made rocket engines to send U.S. military satellites into space, telling exasperated lawmakers they are moving quickly to end the practice and rely on American-made rockets for the launches.

headline.main: Pentagon Defends Use of Russian Engines to Launch Satellites
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Defends Use of Russian Engines to Launch Satellites
